content:
How can I define an arithmetic progression of real numbers ( or generally, a sequence of some real numbers with recursion) a1,a2,..., an for a fixed n in lean?
I am relatively new. Thanks.

def foo : Nat -> Nat
| 0 => 37
| n+1 => 2 * foo n

like this?
Lean 4 doesn't yet have real numbers, are you using lean 3 mathlib? That would go in the #new members stream
Yes, this is an example. How can I write it if I have a functional equation in sequence? for example foo n-k + foo n+k = 2n?
you have to express it in a well founded way, for example foo n can only depend on foo m for m < n
and even then you will have problems in lean 4 because well founded recursion is not yet supported. In lean 3 you can prove that the argument is decreasing and define the function that way
once you have defined the sequence, you can prove the functional equation
based on the setting I would recommend that you use lean 3 / mathlib for now. Lean 4 doesn't have a big maths library yet and you will want it
Atllkks has marked this topic as resolved.
